Description: Fragment from body of North Ionian pottery vessel, krater, dinos or amphora, decorated in several registers separated by bands with superimposed added red bands. In the main frieze is a lion following a bull(?) to left, in thick filling ornament; below: meander band; traces of other friezes top and bottom.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Robinson 1893 / Catalogue of Greek, Etruscan and Roman Vases (p. 223, no. 103)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.944)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Museum of Fine Arts, Boston
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: P.4668 (Pottery & Porcelain Ledger No.)
